title: Draconian zealot
data:

*For a list of all draconians, see [list of draconians](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians").*

| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | This draconian derives its hellish powers and demonic allies from the worship of some unknown dark god.***“Trogdor was a man! I mean, he was a dragon-man! Or... maybe he was just a dragon. ... And the Trogdor comes in the night!” -The Brothers Chaps, “Trogdor”. 2003. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Draconian zealots** are priests of an evil god. They are generally found in [the Realm of Zot](/The_Realm_of_Zot "The Realm of Zot") or, rarely, [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss").

## Spells

| Spell set |                                                                   |                                                     |
| :-------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1     | [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon")                      | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2     | [Call Down Damnation](/Call_Down_Damnation "Call Down Damnation") | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3     | [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17)                              | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4     | [Minor Healing](/Minor_Healing "Minor Healing") (2d8)             | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- [Aura of Abjuration](/Aura_of_Abjuration "Aura of Abjuration") will help against its summons. [Silence](/Silence "Silence") will prevent the zealot from using any spell.

## History

- Draconian zealots were removed in [0.20](/0.20 "0.20").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), they could cast [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead").
html:
Draconian zealot

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For a list of all draconians, see list of draconians.


draconian zealot q 
HP 72-88
HD 16
XP 1618
Speed 10
AC 13
EV 10
Will 40
Attack1 15 (hit: plain)


Resistances rF+, rSticky
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type draconian, draconian
Flags Evil
Cold-blooded
Speaks
This draconian derives its hellish powers and demonic allies from the worship of some unknown dark god.

“Trogdor was a man!
I mean, he was a dragon-man!
Or... maybe he was just a dragon.
...
And the Trogdor comes in the night!”
-The Brothers Chaps, “Trogdor”. 2003.


Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Draconian zealots are priests of an evil god. They are generally found in the Realm of Zot or, rarely, the Abyss.

Spells

Spell set
Slot1 Summon Demon Priest flag
Slot2 Call Down Damnation Priest flag
Slot3 Smiting (7-17) Priest flag
Slot4 Minor Healing (2d8) Priest flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Aura of Abjuration will help against its summons. Silence will prevent the zealot from using any spell.

History

  • Draconian zealots were removed in 0.20.
  • Prior to 0.17, they could cast Animate Dead.
